bioms in the end with a cross between villagers and alians so also with villages in the end

I definitely agree that the end should be updated similar to how the nether was updated a few years ago. More biomes would definitely be exciting because I believe the end only has two or maybe three at the moment. More structures, maybe like an end shipwreck or an end temple would be cool, along with friendly villager or piglin like mobs ("frienderman" perhaps?) In my opinion the most important parts to improve would be the terrain generation and the vegetation, although more creatures would naturally go along with that. There definitely should be a liquid added to the end, even if its just water (although liquid milk is an interesting idea). Trees, grass and more plants in general I think need to be added. The end also seems like a good place to get interesting vines, and a flower with some sort of special secret (maybe just healing or maybe something more, I'll leave that up to the developers). Perhaps endermites could naturally spawn and feed on some of the vegetation. Seeing how the end is made up of a bunch of islands, a flying mob would make sense (perhaps even one you could ride, although that might easily get overpowered). Since there is already an ender-dragon, A different kind of mob would probably be better, such as a space horse (similar to a flying sea horse) that would live in an end-style space coral reef. It could also be cool to have some rare dragon nests with a small chance of containing another ender-dragon egg so that you can get multiple eggs.

This could also contribute to improving archaeology by integrating the destroyed cities with archaeology features. I am not the biggest fan of the existing archaeology features, but I think it would be nice if mojang were able to improve the system, maybe I would be more willing to interact with it.

I disagree.  It would look strange in my opinion because concrete powder is basically recolored sand.

I do like the idea of new fish species.

Well they have red sand, so maybe just black sand would do. Concrete powder is slightly more vibrant and saturated than regular sand, so maybe just a dull, dark grey for black sand. Wouldn‚Äôt that look really cool, a black sand beach next to a gigantic volcano?

I like the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãa sky biome, Minecraft has already worked on renovating the caves and modifying the surface of the overworld but the sky is something that hasn't been tried yet.  
The idea of ‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äãexpanding the game upwards and Promoting the player to go up to the sky seems like an interesting idea to add content vertically.
It also seems like a friendlier idea to approach a new place that is more visible to the player, a biome that makes you curious to go up. Although the distance upwards is very great.
The idea is already clear, but what would this place be like? And what would be there?
I think that to maintain coherence it should be a very light biome.
Find new blocks such as cloud blocks and mechanics in them, such as when you step on them they fall apart, also that they can contain water and generate rain under them,
Without a doubt, with this many more ideas and mechanics can be implemented.
but I think the most important thing and following the initial idea is to maintain the curiosity factor,
adding some variants that make each sky biome different from the other and thus maintaining the desire in the player climb to the next one they find. The sky is the limit.

I also agree with calaveras11010 I think that white wood would be better obviously also coming with fences, stairs, slabs, planks, etc. And the leaves should drop cherries when destroyed, which could either be in pairs or single cherries. And maybe they give you two hunger points more?

I love the idea for "cherry trees" or "cherry blossoms" in my vanilla Minecraft gameplay. They should be found in lower quantities than the standard "Green Oak Trees" in other subtropical biomes, though more common to the flower fields biome. They should be found in four color variations pink (common), white (common), yellow (uncommon), and a light, "spring or lime" green (uncommon). I'd like these trees to be planted near some decorative ponds around my home base, and would like other options besides green trees to grow.  Another feature that could be added is a light blanket of petals that appear both under the foliage and in the area directly around that space, over time. The petals should only appear on flat blocks, both under the tree & around the tree. Snow & running water should stop this light blanket from appearing, and it would only appear three or four blocks down from the trees trunk. The fallen petals would look nice over both on the ground & on the pond.

If the Devs do implement these trees in vanilla Minecraft, perhaps occasional, or "periodic", fallen petal-like particles can happen. Though foliage & petal falling effects might be a  RTX-Exclusive feature.
It‚Äôd be pretty cool if they exclusively spawned in flower forest biomes as well.

No. Perhaps they should be more prominent in the flower forest biomes. However they naturally are found in any subtropical environments.

Of course there should be fewer of them found than the green trees. But I really want something other than green & dark green trees. The blossoms are more commonly pink & white, though can also be found as yellow or a light, "Easter" lime green.
I NEEEED cherry trees in my life!!!!!!

Great idea! A volcano sounds like a place where ruined portals and nether structures lie maybe an abandoned village will be nearby like Pompeii and maybe it will be covered in ash, basalt, obsidian, and cobblestone.

Since the new cliffs update is coming out, what if the volcanoes only spawn rarely in a mountain biome? Since diamonds and nether materials would spawn here, it should be pretty rare. I know this next thing doesn‚Äôt make too much sense, but what if a new igneous rock was added there, (like pumice) and could act as the lava equivalent of a sponge. I think that that would be very helpful for epic saves and searching under lava. Pumice could also be used as a new stone building block. I think these would add more uses to finding a volcano that just there being rare materials there.

They could also make the volcanoes out of ash soo the ash can be picked up with a shovel and the ash can be used to put in a camp fire because there is ash on the bottom to make the flames higher. The volcanoes would be more common on Islands maybe even island chains similar to Hawaii.

There could be 3 different types of volcanoes, explosive, which would look like a normal mountain until they exploded, sending rock and ash spewing and covering everything in a 90 block vicinity with a mix of pumice/blackstone/basalt and the ash block. The ash block could have gravity physics to cover everything equally.  There could also be ash layers. The second type, shield, or passive, could erupt more frequently could have calmer slopes and lava rivers, as they wouldn't explode, per say, but would passively produce pumice around the lava rivers. The third type, extinct, would never erupt and be easier to explore, and beneath it would be a giant extinct magma lake. The cave would be surrounded by pumice and basalt types to be cooled magma. Ores would be extremely common here as it has been compressed for so long here. Just an idea.
There should also be something like a volcano core which you can destroy to stop the eruption but maybe im going to far

I think the update that has volcanoes should also add the block that the volcano is made of (Called Cinder), which could make some building material.

There is lava IRL, it is found in volcanoes and inside Earth. In Minecraft, lava is found on the surface, in caves, and in The Nether. Since The Nether is under the Overworld or inside the planet it makes sense that there be lava there. But why in other places? And why are there no volcanoes?? I have felt that Minecraft needs volcanoes for years. Obviously, there should be something special there, and they should erupt (or explode) every now and then.
Great idea I‚Äôve always wanted these

Cattails are also good for the swamp itself in that it prevents erosion from happening. It also provides shelter and protection for different types of critters such as various amphibians, reptiles, and birds. We need this in Minecraft.

honestly this suggestion would really tie-in with what the wild update is going for: expanding upon biodiversity and even danger. Having the Cattail catch players trying to make their way through (and not do any damage, hopefully) in overgrown areas of the swamp would really be dangerous in some situations, while its other functions are rather unique and passive. It's a perfect balance of both worlds.

Pleeeeeease do it! This is such a great idea and shoul be done. But it would be also cool if it generated in the overworld, as a cave biome, deep down.
yeah, the warped forest is meant to be a "safe haven", so maybe a new hostile mob, or just Zoglins. Since they attack anything, they don't work well in other ecosystems.

Instead of water it should be something like sulfuric acid which would kill the player and take durability from their armor, and maybe for even more danger, a sulfuric creature of some sort, like a deadly worm or something new. I like the idea of a bug or a microorganism like a tardigrade which would survive in this grueling environment

1. This would be a great opportunity to implement the soulfires and their lore in a more natural way, perhaps this could be an area that attracts hoglins and /or is a breeding ground for striders much like how turtles return to the same beach for breeding. But the soulfires keep the piglins from building and pillaging these creature friendly areas.

2.The steam is a must to keep the strider tadpoles or eggs warm in their vulnerable state before they grow or hatch and seek out the lava ocean as adults.

3.The waters here should have some adverse effect on aquatic life limiting what can spawn (a couple nether fish or mutated fish varieties) alongside being beneficial to strider babies. The water can be enchanted in some way further incorporating the brewing, enchantment table, and soul fire lore from the nether. Frostwalker would either not work here or only have a 2x2 diameter.

4.If this clashes with the warped forest on the safety front, it could be a rare/special variety of warped forests like the podzoil tiaga biome.

5. If the water survives in the nether that means it obviously has a higher boiling point than overworld water. This means it would never freeze in the overworld even in the coldest of biomes or at least take longer to freeze provided frostwalker is not involved, due to having a lower freezing point.

6. Finally, perhaps this could be a place where Blazes spawn naturally as hostile mobs and the water here could then be explained by having some sort of blaze powder remnants, you could possibly create a bucket of blaze water straight from the source or by adding a blaze rod to a bucket of water in the crafting screen. This would allow players to terraform the biome or create tanks for the special fish or strider pools. The blaze water could be found in the hoglin pens in the piglin bastions and be used to saturate nethercrop farmlands.

Aslangames because the swamp always has the same trees. Flooded forests can be in spruce forests, birch forests, you name it. Its just a game of chance really. Swamps and flooded forests are two very different things. Flooded forests water levels vary for every individual flooded forest (e.g so water may reach the leaves in one flooded forest, but in a different flooded forest water may only climb two blocks up the trunk of the tree), whereas swamps are always the same.

Trees, grass, and flowers could produce bioluminescent light with level 5. Leaves should be different colors such as light blue, pink, and yellow. They should have a glow on blocks 1 or 2 away. This will give those blocks a slight color. This biome could also introduce new dye colors made from the new flowers that grow here. The flowers could need light level between 3 - 7 to spawn.

This biome should also include Crystals as mentioned in other posts. They would grow from walls, ceiling and floor. The crystals should come in different colors and also glow. Crystals could be mined with a pickaxes. Afterwards they drop shards which have to be crafted back into the crystals. When a torch is placed next to the crystal, the light passing through the crystal creates a colored pattern on the blocks lit by the torch.
